Medications or Treatments that Suppress the Immune System
justification: Can cause sensory neuropathies, fatigue (which can manifest as muscle pain), and anemia (sometimes with monocytosis).}, {diagnosis: Diabetes Mellitus (Type 1 or 2)

justification: Long-term complications can include neuropathy, particularly sensory neuropathy.  Hyperglycemia can irritate the eyes.  Muscle pain can be a side effect of medications used to treat diabetes, and monocytosis can occur with uncontrolled diabetes.}, {diagnosis: Sjögrens Syndrome

justification: An autoimmune disorder that commonly causes dry eyes and mouth, but can also lead to neuropathies, muscle pain, and fatigue. Hyperthyroidism can sometimes occur alongside other autoimmune conditions.}, {diagnosis: Sarcoidosis

justification: This inflammatory disease can cause a wide range of symptoms, including neuropathies, muscle pain, eye involvement (uveitis), and elevated blood calcium levels (which can lead to hyperthyroidism in some cases). Monocytosis can be present.}, {diagnosis: Lyme Disease (Late Stage)

justification: Untreated Lyme disease can lead to neurological symptoms like neuropathies, muscle and joint pain, and fatigue. Eye inflammation and thyroid issues are less common but possible.}, {diagnosis: HIV/AIDS

justification: HIV can cause a variety of neurological problems, including neuropathies. Monocytosis and muscle pain can also occur. Eye problems are common in HIV/AIDS, and thyroid issues can arise.}, {diagnosis: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)

justification: MS frequently causes sensory disturbances and neuropathies.  Muscle pain and fatigue are also common.  Optic neuritis (eye inflammation) can occur, and thyroid problems are more common in people with MS.}, {diagnosis: Vasculitis (Certain Types)

justification: Inflammation of blood vessels can affect various organs, leading to neuropathies, muscle pain, eye problems, and in some cases, thyroid abnormalities. Monocytosis can be a sign of inflammation.}, {diagnosis: Celiac Disease

justification: Though primarily a digestive disorder, celiac disease can cause nutrient deficiencies leading to neuropathy, muscle pain, and fatigue.  It can also lead to other autoimmune problems, potentially affecting the thyroid or causing joint pain.}, {diagnosis: Medication Side Effects
justification: Always consider that a combination of symptoms could be due to medication side effects. Review the patients medication list carefully.}
